descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course introduces sociological approaches to economic institutions and behavior. The goal is to provide a set of sociological ideas to understand markets, prices, corporations, supply, demand, production, work, exchange, property, and other economic topics, in a different way.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
During preregistration this course is only open to Sociology & BIP Majors & Minors.

This course is open to all undergraduates during regular registration.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Requirements include a take-home assignment (worth 25% of the grade), a midterm (25%), and a final exam (40%). Participation in discussion sections is worth 10%.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
